intro: Stigmaphyllon australiense, commonly known as the Australian stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Stigmaphyllon australiense is often found in shrublands and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
